macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Trump's Tariff Threats Spark Global Market Selloff
items.summary: Trump's renewed tariff threats have triggered sharp declines in European and Asian markets, with Germany's DAX down 1.57%, London's FTSE down 1.4%, and S&P 500 futures down 1.75%; VIX volatility index surges 27% over past five days as investors seek safety in gold, up 1.17%. Markets show caution after past overreactions to similar threats.

items.title: US Indexes Hit Record Highs Last Friday Amid Rate Cut Optimism
items.summary: Dow Jones closed above 47,000 for the first time, up 1%; S&P 500 rose 0.8% and Nasdaq gained 1.2%, all at record highs following cooler inflation data and US-China trade truce signals ahead of Trump-Xi meeting. Focus shifts to Fed's Powell testimony this week.

items.title: S&P 500 Technical Outlook Turns Bearish with Pullback Risks
items.summary: S&P 500 (US500) shows bearish potential direction despite bullish momentum, with pivot at 6,901.20 and first support at lower levels; broader indices like DXY bearish, AUDUSD with support at 0.6661.

items.title: Crypto Markets Face Liquidation Wave, Ethereum Hit Hardest
items.summary: Ethereum suffers $27.09 million in liquidations amid risk-off sentiment; Bitcoin also impacted, with XRP, Dogecoin, BNB, and Cardano seeing smaller liquidations and shifting to bearish retail sentiment on Stocktwits.

items.title: Tesla Shares Decline Amid Broader Market Pressures
items.summary: Tesla stock closed at 423.65 on Jan 20, down from previous levels around 426-430, reflecting ongoing volatility; prior session on Jan 16 saw close at 435.26.

items.title: Fiserv Stock Dips 0.73% in Latest Session
items.summary: Fiserv (FISV) closed at 66.29 on Jan 19, down 0.73% with trading volume of 8.29 million shares, amid mixed financial services sector performance.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Price Drops 2.6% to $90,600 Low, Erasing January Gains
items.summary: Bitcoin fell 2.6% in the past 24 hours, hitting a low around $90,600 and testing the critical $90,770 point of control, with RSI reaching oversold levels at 24-26. Bulls are fading as January futures prices decline solidly in early trading.
items.source: CryptoPotato / Kitco News / YouTube Bitcoin Summary

items.title: Ethereum Pectra Upgrade Anticipated in Q1 2026, Impacting Volatility
items.summary: Ethereum's Pectra upgrade, combining Prague and Electra improvements, is slated for potential Q1 launch, affecting validator economics and gas fees, which could drive ETH volatility amid macro data releases.

items.title: Major Token Unlocks Set for January 2026 in Aptos, Optimism, Avalanche, and Starknet
items.summary: Upcoming unlocks include ~24M Aptos (APT) tokens (2.4% of supply), Optimism (OP) team/investor cliffs, Avalanche (AVAX) vesting, and Starknet (STRK) initial investor release, expected to increase market volatility.

items.title: Layer-2 Updates from Arbitrum, Optimism, and zkSync Fuel Ecosystem Volatility
items.summary: Layer-2 solutions like Arbitrum, Optimism, and zkSync are rolling out new sequencer mechanisms and fee structures, impacting L2 tokens and built applications through testnets and mainnet deployments.

items.title: NASDAQ Plans Crypto Asset Tokenization Platform
items.summary: NASDAQ is set to launch a platform for tokenizing assets and crypto exchanges, highlighting growing institutional interest in blockchain infrastructure.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI at Davos 2026: Tech Leaders Discuss AGI, Job Displacement, and Safety Standards
items.summary: At the World Economic Forum, tech executives including Microsoft's Satya Nadella and Anthropic's Dario Amodei addressed AI's impact on work, with warnings that AI could eliminate half of entry-level white-collar jobs and that AGI could arrive within 5-10 years. Leaders called for international safety standards to be developed at a measured pace.

items.title: MIT Research Reveals $25 Billion in Potential Savings Through Open AI Models
items.summary: A new MIT study found that users could reduce AI inference costs by over 70% while improving performance by switching to open-source models, with potential industry-wide savings of approximately $25 billion annually. Currently, proprietary models from OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google account for nearly 80% of processed AI tokens.

items.title: OpenAI Announces Strategic Shift and ChatGPT Speed Enhancement Partnership
items.summary: OpenAI made significant announcements regarding ChatGPT updates and a groundbreaking partnership with Cerebras that promises to enhance processing speed by a factor of 100, signaling a major shift in the company's strategic direction.

items.title: MIT Researchers Overcome AI Context Window Limitations
items.summary: MIT researchers have presented groundbreaking advancements that challenge traditional context window limits in AI models, enabling more effective machine learning systems capable of processing information without previous constraints.

items.title: AI Achieves Breakthrough in Solving Complex Mathematical Problems
items.summary: Artificial intelligence has achieved a groundbreaking milestone by solving one of the most challenging math problems in modern history, promising to reshape understanding of computational problem-solving capabilities.

items.title: Meta Pivots from Metaverse to $70 Billion AI Investment
items.summary: Meta is shifting its strategic focus away from the metaverse toward artificial intelligence, committing $70 billion to AI technology development amid significant organizational changes.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Konami Gaming's Money in the Bank Slot Series Tops Industry Rankings
items.summary: Konami Gaming's Money in the Bank™ slot series, including Bacon Blvd.™ and Pay Out West™, ranked No. 1 and No. 5 in top indexing new games for core video reel slots according to Eilers & Krejcik Gaming and Fantini Research. The series features innovative 'shake the bank' and 'break the bank' mechanics in a hold and spin bonus.

items.title: Fallout 76 Receives Major Update Today
items.summary: Bethesda Game Studios released a new update for Fallout 76 on January 20, 2026, bringing improvements to the Appalachia region.

items.title: IO Interactive CEO Advocates Smaller Budgets for AAA Sequels
items.summary: IO Interactive CEO Hakan Abrak states that lower budgets for Hitman 2 and 3 after heavy R&D on the 2016 Hitman helped make the company sustainable.

items.title: AI Usage in Video Game Art Assets on the Rise in 2026
items.summary: AI is increasingly used for creating video game assets like concept art and placeholder textures, marking a growing trend in the industry.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Canadian Government Invests $90M in Mangrove Lithium for Battery-Grade Production
items.summary: The federal government is providing up to US$65 million to Mangrove Lithium in Delta, Canada, to advance cutting-edge technology for producing battery-grade lithium with lower waste and carbon footprint. The funding supports a new commercial facility to produce 20,000 tonnes of lithium hydroxide annually, enough for 500,000 electric vehicles.

items.title: Akkuyu Nuclear Plant's First Unit Reaches 99% Completion
items.summary: The first unit of Turkey's Akkuyu nuclear power plant is now 99% complete, marking a major milestone in the country's energy infrastructure development.

items.title: RP Global to Construct One of Poland's Largest Wind Farms at 123.9 MW
items.summary: RP Global announced plans to start construction on a 123.9 megawatt wind farm, set to become one of Poland's largest renewable energy projects.

items.title: European Trenchless Rehabilitation Companies Form Strategic Alliance
items.summary: Companies including resinnovation, Polypipe, Amex Sanivar, Hurricane Trenchless Technologie, and Kardiam have joined forces with backing from Apheon – IMS Group to create a leading provider of innovative pipe rehabilitation solutions in the trenchless technology market.
